Compute E-values for Estimates and Confidence Intervales

gfs_compute_evalue.Rd

TO-DO

Usage

gfs_compute_evalue(
  est,
  se = NULL,
  sd = NULL,
  ci.low = NULL,
  ci.up = NULL,
  type = "linear",
  rare = 0,
  what = c("EE", "ECI")
)

Arguments

est

effect estimate

se

standard error of estimate

sd

standard deviation of outcome

ci.low

lower confidence limit

ci.up

upper confidence limit

type

how to compute evalue (linear or RR)

rare

an option used in the evalues package

what

define which values to extract (default is both using `c("EE", "ECI")`)

Value

a vector containing * EE, E-value for estimate * ECI, E-value for confidence interval

Details

Conduct simple sensitivity analyses for OLS or RR estimates. This is a wrapper for the evalues package.

Examples


load_packages()
#> function (...) 
#> capture_output(.f(...))
#> <bytecode: 0x12b47cbb8>
#> <environment: 0x12b47ce58>
gfs_compute_evalue(est = 0.20, se=0.11, sd=1, type='linear')
#>       EE      ECI 
#> 1.688961 1.000000 
gfs_compute_evalue(est = 0.20, ci.low=-0.02, ci.up=0.42, type='RR')
#>       EE      ECI 
#> 1.741424 1.000000
